entries.title: How Gautam Adani Made (and Could Lose) a $147 Billion Fortune
entries.description: The Indian businessman built an empire, the Adani Group, by working closely with the Modi government. A critical report by a U.S. short seller has put it at risk.

entries.title: U.K. Hit by Biggest Strikes in a Decade
entries.description: The strikes reflect a growing challenge to the U.K. and some European countries of how to address falling real wages for many public-sector workers without further stoking inflation.

entries.title: EU Sets Out Options to Compete With U.S. Green Subsidies
entries.description: The European Union’s executive body set out a road map for competing with U.S. green subsidies with a range of tools that could include coordinated tax rebates and looser rules for approving government aid.

entries.title: Missing Radioactive Capsule Found in Australian Outback
entries.description: A tiny capsule containing radioactive material that sparked a search over hundreds of miles of highway has been found.

entries.title: Court Ruling Highlights Improving South Korea-Japan Ties
entries.description: A South Korean court ruling in favor of a Japanese temple is the latest sign that the two long-squabbling neighbors are getting along better.

entries.title: OPEC+ Ministers Set to Stay the Course Amid China Covid Woes
entries.description: An OPEC+ panel will likely recommend keeping the group’s current oil-production policy unchanged, delegates said.

entries.title: Ukraine Denounces Western Executives at Russian Companies
entries.description: While executives aren’t breaking any laws if working at companies that aren’t sanctioned by the U.S. or its allies, Kyiv says their presence risks undermining broader efforts to isolate the country internationally.

entries.title: Ukraine Braces for Major Russian Offensive
entries.description: Russia is preparing to launch a major new offensive against Ukraine in the coming weeks, a top Ukrainian security official said.

entries.title: French Forces Seize Iranian-Supplied Weapons Bound for Yemen
entries.description: Elite French special forces seized a boatload of Iranian-supplied weapons and ammunition bound for Yemen as part of a deepening effort to contain Tehran, according to officials familiar with the operation.
